Name: Azure - Deploy Container App
Description: Deploys a container to an Azure Container App Environment

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.ResourceGroup.Name
Parameters.Label: Azure Resource Group Name
Parameters.HelpText: Provide the resource group name to create the environment in.

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Account.SubscriptionId
Parameters.Label: Azure Account Subscription Id
Parameters.HelpText:
The subscription ID of the Azure account to use.  This value can be retrieved from an Azure Account variable type.  Add an Azure Account to your project , then assign the `SubscriptionNumber` property to for this entry.  Leave blank to use the Managed Identity.

For example, if your Azure Account variable is called MyAccount, the value for this input would be `#{MyAccount.SubscriptionNumber}`

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Account.ClientId
Parameters.Label: Azure Account Client Id
Parameters.HelpText:
The subscription ID of the Azure account to use.  This value can be retrieved from an Azure Account variable type.  Add an Azure Account to your project , then assign the `Client` property to for this entry.   Leave blank to use the Managed Identity.

For example, if your Azure Account variable is called MyAccount, the value for this input would be `#{MyAccount.Client}`

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Account.TenantId
Parameters.Label: Azure Account Tenant Id
Parameters.HelpText:
The subscription ID of the Azure account to use.  This value can be retrieved from an Azure Account variable type.  Add an Azure Account to your project , then assign the `TenantId` property to for this entry.   If blank, it will use the Managed Identity tenant.

For example, if your Azure Account variable is called MyAccount, the value for this input would be `#{MyAccount.TenantId}`

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Account.Password
Parameters.Label: Azure Account Password
Parameters.HelpText:
The subscription ID of the Azure account to use.  This value can be retrieved from an Azure Account variable type.  Add an Azure Account to your project , then assign the `Password` property to for this entry.   Leave blank to use the Managed Identity.

For example, if your Azure Account variable is called MyAccount, the value for this input would be `#{MyAccount.Password}`

Parameters.Name: Template.ContainerApp.Environment.Name
Parameters.Label: Container App Environment Name
Parameters.HelpText: The name or ID of the container app environment to deploy to.

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Location.Name
Parameters.Label: Azure Location
Parameters.HelpText: The location in which to create the container app environment.

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Container.Name
Parameters.Label: Container Name
Parameters.HelpText: The name of the container to create/update.  If you want to use the image name, specify `#{Octopus.Action.Package[Template.Azure.Container.Image].PackageId}`

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Container.Image
Parameters.Label: Container Image
Parameters.HelpText: Select the container image to deploy.

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Container.Variables
Parameters.Label: Environment variables

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Container.Secrets
Parameters.Label: Secrets
Parameters.HelpText:
JSON formatted key/value pair of secrets to create/update.  This supports use of OctoStache.

**Note:** The name of the secret must be lowercase.

```
[
  {
    "name": "mysecret",
    "value": "#{Project.SQL.Admin.Password}"
  },
 ...
]
```

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Container.Cpu
Parameters.Label: Resource CPU
Parameters.HelpText:
The amount of CPU to allocate to the container app.

Example: 0.5

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Container.Memory
Parameters.Label: Resource Memory
Parameters.HelpText:
The amount of memory to allocate to the container app.

Examples: 250Mb or 4.0Gi

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Container.Ingress.Port
Parameters.Label: Container Ingress Port
Parameters.HelpText: The port to allow traffic to the container.

Parameters.Name: Template.Azure.Container.ExternalIngress
Parameters.Label: External Ingress
Parameters.HelpText: Whether the ingress is externally accessible or not.
